Issues.Title: Cleanup ListControl
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Cleanup ListControl" (#674)

Issues.Title: WinForms in .NET Core 3.0 should be at functional parity with .NET Framework 4.8
Issues.Body: Wherever possible .NET Core 3.0 WinForms should have the same functionality that .NET Framework does. There will be changes in some places, but these should be intentional rather than spontaneous. We need to port .NET 4.8 fixes in HDPI, Accessibility, and other feature areas to achieve this.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "WinForms in .NET Core 3.0 should be at functional parity with .NET Framework 4.8" (#673)

Issues.Title: Test Infrastructure Parity with Framework
Issues.Body: This epic tracks getting our test infrastructure that we used for .NET Framework ported to the Arcade infrastructure.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Test Infrastructure Parity with Framework" (#672)

Issues.Title: Integrate Framework end-to-end tests into Helix/Arcade
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Integrate Framework end-to-end tests into Helix/Arcade" (#671)

Issues.Title: Code Cleanup and Enhancements
Issues.Body: This epic will track the work we want to do towards code cleanup.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Code Cleanup and Enhancements" (#670)

Issues.Title: [fail]: OmniSharp.MSBuild.ProjectManager         Attemped to update project that is not loaded
Issues.Body:
# Issue Title

[fail]: OmniSharp.MSBuild.ProjectManager
        Attemped to update project that is not loaded

# General
im try using .net core 3 to work with winform , after following instruction from githup page, im enter some comand such as : dotnet new winforms -o 'my-name-app', dot net run, and finally , i got this output from output tab in VS code

```

[info]: OmniSharp.Services.DotNetCliService
        DotNetPath set to dotnet

[info]: OmniSharp.MSBuild.Discovery.MSBuildLocator

            CscToolExe = csc.exe
            CscToolPath = c:\Users\luc dao dai nhan\.vscode\extensions\ms-vscode.csharp-1.16.1-beta1\.omnisharp\1.32.5\msbuild\15.0\Bin\Roslyn
            MSBuildExtensionsPath = c:\Users\luc dao dai nhan\.vscode\extensions\ms-vscode.csharp-1.16.1-beta1\.omnisharp\1.32.5\msbuild
            MSBuildToolsPath = c:\Users\luc dao dai nhan\.vscode\extensions\ms-vscode.csharp-1.16.1-beta1\.omnisharp\1.32.5\msbuild\15.0\Bin
[info]: OmniSharp.Cake.CakeProjectSystem
        Detecting Cake files in 'c:\Users\luc dao dai nhan\Desktop\dotnet-sdk-latest-win-x86\winform'.

[info]: OmniSharp.MSBuild.ProjectManager
```

Issues.Title: change to binary log location to use new vso vars
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "change to binary log location to use new vso vars" (#669)

Issues.Title: UIAutomation keeps Form instance alive
Issues.Body:
* Tested on .NET Framework 4.5.2 only.

**Problem description:**

Obtaining a Form's AutomationElement causes Form to be not eligible for garbage collection - Form instances remain in memory - this is illustrated in the attached repro. This causes trouble for creating stress tests.

This is also reproducible with UIAv3 using wrapper from https://www.nuget.org/packages/TestStack.White.Uia3/ package.

I didn't check if the same behavior exists for WPF Window.

**Minimal repro:**

[WindowsFormsApp4.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/3029300/WindowsFormsApp4.zip)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "UIAutomation keeps Form instance alive" (#660)

Issues.Title: System.Drawing.ColorConverter throws exception for ConvertFrom
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: (e.g. 3.0 Preview1, or daily build number, use `dotnet --info`)
* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: Yes/No

<!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->

**Problem description:**
Migrating from 4.5.2 to .net core preview  3 we found 

var tc = new System.Drawing.ColorConverter()
var color = tc.ConvertFrom("Control");

**Actual behavior:** <!-- callstack for crashes / exceptions -->
```
System.ArgumentException
  HResult=0x80070057
  Message=Control is not a valid value for Int32.
  Source=System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter
  StackTrace:
   at System.Drawing.ColorConverterCommon.IntFromString(String text, CultureInfo culture)
   at System.Drawing.ColorConverterCommon.ConvertFromString(String strValue, CultureInfo culture)
   at System.Drawing.ColorConverter.ConvertFrom(ITypeDescriptorContext context, CultureInfo culture, Object value)
   at Sgcib.Daf.Shell.Handler.ShellConfiguration.ConfigValueOf[T](String key, T defaultValue) in H:\SG\Git\SourcesSocgen\XOneTools\DafNetCore30\src\Shell\Handler\ShellConfiguration.cs:line 51

Inner Exception 1:
FormatException: Input string was not in a correct format.
```

**Expected behavior:**

Â  returns "{Name=Control, ARGB=(255, 240, 240, 240)}"

**Minimal repro:**
```
var tc = new System.Drawing.ColorConverter()
var color = tc.ConvertFrom("Control");
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "System.Drawing.ColorConverter throws exception for ConvertFrom" (#667)

Issues.Title: Cleanup DataGridViewRow
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Cleanup DataGridViewRow" (#659)

Issues.Title: Fix strange oversight in Buttons test form
Issues.Body: For some reason, the FlatStyle of each control was not being set in this form's constructor, which makes testing the different FlatStyles rather difficult. This is now fixed.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Fix strange oversight in Buttons test form" (#657)

Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "[master] Update dependencies from dotnet/core-setup" (#649)

Issues.Title: LOC CHECKIN | dotnet/winforms master | 20190401
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "LOC CHECKIN | dotnet/winforms master | 20190401" (#661)

Issues.Title: Update MessageFilters to use List<T>
Issues.Body:
This was using ArrayList, which should be updated, especially in Core 3.0.

In addition, uses a List rather then an array for the filter snapshot to avoid requiring allocation every filter, but instead only the first time a filter gets added.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Update MessageFilters to use List<T>" (#658)

Issues.Title: Set Control.Defaultfont to SystemFonts.MessageBoxFont
Issues.Body:
This change ensures Segoe UI is used by default on Windows Vista and later, while still not breaking compatibility with Windows XP or systems compatible with it. Fixes #524.

Note that while I have not yet been able to test the code in System.Design.Editors as requested in https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/524#issuecomment-469832174 due to #632 not yet being merged, I have tested with the WinformsControlTest project, and all of its forms/controls (including the ThreadExceptionDialog) are sized properly to avoid clipping text, with _no_ changes needed. While I do not think any changes will be needed to the designer code either, I am willing to hold on this PR until that can be tested. Thanks!
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Set Control.Defaultfont to SystemFonts.MessageBoxFont" (#656)

Issues.Title: Can't use windows class names with different capitalization in the same application
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Can't use windows class names with different capitalization in the same application" (#654)

Issues.Title: locked string "Web" because it should not be localized
Issues.Body: This is take 2, I added a comment to resx file and the xlf files were generated by the build. This seems to be consistent with what Roslyn has in their repo.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "locked string "Web" because it should not be localized" (#645)

Issues.Title: Move to Build Your Own Cloud (BYOC)
Issues.Body: RoslynTools.msbuild version changed from 16.0.0-alpha (implicit from vs) to 16.0.0-cl1-alpha; which will not be explicitly referenced https://dotnet.myget.org/feed/roslyn-tools/package/nuget/RoslynTools.MSBuild which is a workaround for Arcade hard-coding this path to include our tools.vs.version + .0-alpha which is no longer valid
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Move to Build Your Own Cloud (BYOC)" (#647)

Issues.Title: Port System.Windows.Forms.Design.ControlDesigner
Issues.Body:
This component has a dependency on ToolStrip components, which are potentially part of #215 

I discovered this list so far which are toolstrip related:
ToolStripTemplateNode

BaseContextMenuStrip        
ContextMenuStripGroup        
ContextMenuStripGroupCollection        
DesignerToolStripControlHost
GroupedContextMenuStrip
ItemTypeToolStripMenuItem
NewItemsContextMenuStrip
StandardCommandToolStripMenuItem
TemplateNodeSelectionState
ToolStripAdornerWindowService
ToolStripDesignerUtils
ToolStripItemDesigner
ToolStripKeyboardHandlingService
ToolStripTemplateNode

Related issues: #585, #221
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Port System.Windows.Forms.Design.ControlDesigner" (#653)

Issues.Title: Remove artifacts subfolders from .gitignore
Issues.Body:
These exclusions are covered by an existing exclusion of the artifacts top-level folder. Subfolders are intentionally omitted from .gitignore, since the appearance of a file in such a location outside of artifacts
indicates a wider failure of the build structure.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Remove artifacts subfolders from .gitignore" (#648)
